data.title: Centerville K-9 killed after getting loose from handler's home, running onto I-15
data.meta_description: A bloodhound working with the Centerville Police Department has died after she got loose from her handler's home and was hit on I-15.
data.text:
A bloodhound working with the Centerville Police Department has died after she got loose from her handler's home and was hit on I-15, officers said.

They said K-9 Sophie escaped from the home on Sunday evening and a search for her was held through the night.

At approximately 7 a.m. Monday, a bloodhound, later confirmed to be Sophie, was spotted on I-15 running southbound in the northbound lanes of travel just north of Parrish Lane.

Related stories from 2News

Shortly after, officers were notified that the dog had been hit in the HOV lane.

They said the vehicle that hit Sophie has not been located and is not believed to be at fault.

Sophie had been with the Centerville Police Department since November 2019 and was trained in tracking.

"She was an invaluable asset to the community and was instrumental in locating lost children, Alzheimer patients, and fleeing suspects," a press release stated. "Our hearts go out to K9-Sophieâ€™s handler, Officer Jason Shields, and his family. Centerville Police K-9s live with their handlers 24/7."

_____
